dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 291 IH: Vaccine Discharge Parity Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Fitzgerald (for himself, Mr. Bost, Mr. Posey, Mr. Crenshaw, Mr. Huizenga, Mr. Baird, Mrs. Miller-Meeks, Mr. Jackson of Texas, Mr. Hunt, Mr. Moore of Alabama, Mr. Mast, and Mr. Gaetz) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to ensure that a member of the Armed Forces, granted a general discharge under honorable conditions on the sole basis that such member failed to obey a lawful order to receive a vaccine for COVID–19, is eligible for certain educational assistance administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Vaccine Discharge Parity Act.

section.header: Certain educational assistance for a member of the Armed Forces granted a general discharge under honorable conditions on the sole basis that such member failed to obey a lawful order to receive a vaccine for COVID–19

subsection.text: Section 3011(a)(3)(B) of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking an honorable discharge; and inserting an em dash; and
by inserting at the end the following new clauses:

clause.text: a general discharge under honorable conditions on the sole basis that the individual failed to obey a lawful order to receive a vaccine for COVID–19;

subsection.text: Section 3311(c) of such title is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: A general discharge under honorable conditions on the sole basis that the individual failed to obey a lawful order to receive a vaccine for COVID–19.

subsection.text: The loan fee table in section 3729(b)(2) of title 38, United States Code, is amended by striking January 14, 2031 each place it appears and inserting March 1, 2031.
